required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of the FluidVision Accommodation Intraocular Lens (AIOL)
clinical_study.official_title: CLinical Evaluation of the FluidVision AIOL for Accommodation Restoration

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of an investigational IOL in providing a range of vision as compared to a commercially available trifocal IOL in subjects undergoing cataract extraction and IOL implantation.

detailed_description.textblock: Upon obtaining written informed consent and confirmation of subject eligibility via preoperative assessments, subjects were randomized in a 1:1 ratio to receive either the investigational IOL or the commercially available trifocal IOL in both eyes. The second eye for each subject was implanted after completion of the 1-week follow up for the first implanted eye. The expected total duration of participation for each subject was up to 14 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Distance Corrected Near Visual Acuity (DCNVA) at 100% Contrast - First Implanted Eye
primary_outcome.description: Visual acuity was tested at a distance of 40 centimeters with distance correction (plus or minus power) in place.

secondary_outcome.measure: Distance Corrected Intermediate Visual Acuity (DCIVA) at 100% Contrast - First Implanted Eye
secondary_outcome.description: Visual acuity was tested at a distance of 66 centimeters with distance correction (plus or minus power) in place.

secondary_outcome.measure: Distance Corrected Near Visual Acuity (DCNVA) at low contrast - First Implanted Eye
secondary_outcome.description: Visual acuity was tested at a distance of 40 centimeters with distance correction (plus or minus power) in place.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Eyes with 20/32 or Better Visual Acuity Between 4 meters and 40 centimeters on the Defocus Curve
secondary_outcome.description: A series of plus and minus lenses were placed over the subject's best distance manifest correction to simulate distances from far to hear.

arm_group.description: FluidVision AIOL implanted in the capsular bag of the eye during cataract surgery. Both eyes were implanted, with the second eye surgery occurring after the Week 1 follow up for the first eye surgery.

Commercially available trifocal IOL implanted in the capsular bag of the eye during cataract surgery. Both eyes were implanted, with the second eye surgery occurring after the Week 1 follow up for the first eye surgery.

intervention.description: Investigational implantable medical device intended for long-term use over the lifetime of the cataract subject
Commercially available implantable medical device intended for long-term use over the lifetime of the cataract subject
Cataract surgery per investigator's standard practice
